Al Kaline was not only one of the defining players of his generation, but also an example of true class off the diamond.
 
My condolences to the entire Kaline family and to the generations of fans in Michigan & across the country who loved Mr. Tiger.
https://t.co/PhL4dz1D7g

The bipartisan CARES Act was an important first step, but there is still more work to support Michigan families. 
 
@SenStabenow & I Introduced a bill to make families w/ older children & adult dependents eligible for COVID-19 relief payments. https://t.co/yCMI6K0Tug

The CARES Act includes nearly $50 billion in support for agriculture and rural communities.

As Michiganders continue to confront the Coronavirus pandemic, I’ll continue to make sure you know what federal resources are available to you and your family.

I spoke w/ the Genesee County Community Task Force to hear how Flint & Genesee County are fighting back against the Coronavirus.

I applaud the work being done by this task force, in coordination with labor & faith-based leaders, to help Michiganders during this crisis. https://t.co/gc2V3mZ2SI

To all the farmers, growers, and supply line workers who continue working to ensure grocery stores and restaurants are stocked & Michiganders have the essentials they need: thank you. We are grateful for all you do.

More than $53 million in funding will go to Southeast Michigan, over $8 million to West Michigan, over $7 million to Genesee County & the Bay Region and more than $2 million to Mid-Michigan.

@SenStabenow and I announced funding to help local communities across Michigan respond to the Coronavirus pandemic.
 
This funding made possible through the CARES Act includes Community Development Block Grants and Emergency Solutions Grants.

Today @SenStabenow & I spoke with @hhsgov Admiral Giroir about getting desperately needed testing supplies to Michigan. I’ll keep pressing the Administration to send more testing swabs & supplies to help ensure Michiganders can get tested & help limit the spread of Coronavirus.

I’m proud to stand with the frontline workers at our airports in Michigan and across the country who keep our airports secure and clean for passengers. We must ensure resources in the recently enacted CARES Act help protect the health, safety and well-being of these workers.

This is welcome news. After pressing for the Administration to reverse course, I’m glad that Social Security recipients in Michigan & across the country will receive direct assistance from the CARES Act without having to file tax returns. https://t.co/DQxNvlccfH

I’m saddened to learn about the loss of Rep. Isaac Robinson. He was a tireless advocate for the people of Detroit and Hamtramck. Colleen and I are thinking of his family, friends and constituents.

Small businesses are engines of economic growth in Michigan.
 
I fought to make sure the Senate-passed bipartisan Coronavirus package raises funding for minority-owned businesses, increases 7(a) funding & includes 100% guarantees on loans for small businesses impacted by COVID-19 https://t.co/3wcdVrdxcs

Heroes are stepping up across our communities. To those including our brave and selfless doctors and nurses, first responders and law enforcement and those working at grocery stores and restaurants, delivering packages, mail and food: we cannot thank you enough. https://t.co/6MWg7UEWx1

This #VietnamVeteransDay, we honor our brave Vietnam veterans. While many of these veterans—in Michigan & across the country—never received the recognition or welcome home they deserve, we recognize their service and sacrifice.

Colleen made a cake celebrating Oakland County’s 200th birthday!  

We were born & raised here (Colleen in Waterford, me in Rochester Hills). We can’t be with friends, but we’re celebrating at home! Read how this tree became a local icon #Oak200 @OCPHS ➡️ https://t.co/2p9R1pbCrI https://t.co/Rg9jOYsLjE

Yesterday I spoke with @michfoundations, @MNAonline & @miunitedways members across Michigan about how the latest Coronavirus package will help them get through this pandemic. I’ll continue to partner with them to ensure they have the resources to support their communities. https://t.co/GXXC50Oezr
As Ranking Member of @HSGAC, I will keep working to cut through red tape and ensure that Michiganders get the medical supplies and equipment needed to combat Coronavirus.

I have been working with @FEMA Admin Gaynor to address Michigan’s difficulties getting protective gear for our hospitals. Today’s shipment is great news, but Michigan needs more N95s & I’m pushing FEMA to get our next shipment ASAP. https://t.co/uHxdxAS632
I will continue working with @GovWhitmer, the FEMA Administrator, and our MI delegation to ensure our state gets whatever it needs to respond.

Michigan needs help and I’m pleased our state’s request for a major disaster declaration has been approved. This will mean more emergency federal resources as our state battles the Coronavirus pandemic.

Americans need relief now. I worked with my colleagues to improve the final Coronavirus bill to get resources to workers, small businesses and our overstretched health care system.
 
But our work isn't done. Watch my update in the Democratic Weekly Address. https://t.co/tR96bMVxUE

Workers in #MI who are forced to stay home due to the Coronavirus or who have been laid off from their jobs shouldn’t have to worry about whether they can pay their bills or put food on the table.

Learn more about my bipartisan bill to expand the unemployment compensation ⬇️ https://t.co/NvIlcVthFO

Struggling Michiganders need help now. The improved 3rd Coronavirus package I helped pass will:
 
✅Expand unemployment benefits
✅Enable small businesses to access SBA loans
✅Increase support for health care providers on the front lines https://t.co/va1DIk7GvP

I voted for the bipartisan Senate Coronavirus legislation that will provide important relief for Michiganders including expanded unemployment benefits, support for our small businesses and more funding for our hospitals on the front lines. https://t.co/hJbE5ii5aI

We must pass this improved Coronavirus package. We need to quickly help bring relief and support to Michigan workers, families, doctors, nurses and small businesses. There’s more work to do but this is an important step.

Michigan small business owners have told me they’re very worried about the future of their businesses and the need for significant financial support.
 
This package includes over $350 billion to support small businesses, including the @SBAgov’s 7(a) loan program.

Health care professionals at hospitals across Michigan are on the frontlines & desperately need resources to care for patients and protect themselves. I pushed for additional funding for hospitals & this package has a significant increase from the initial bill on Sunday.

I have heard from small business owners, workers in the gig economy, independent contractors & people who can’t go to work or have lost their jobs b/c of Coronavirus. I led a bipartisan bill to expand unemployment benefits for folks out of work due to no fault of their own.

I have been working hard to improve the 3rd Coronavirus package to help bring much-needed relief to Michigan families, workers, small businesses, hospitals and health care professionals as we confront this unprecedented public health and economic crisis.
Michigan families are facing unimaginable and heartbreaking challenges because of the Coronavirus pandemic.

Michigan distilleries are going above and beyond the call of duty by using alcohol to help make much-needed hand sanitizer.

I introduced bipartisan legislation to make sure they aren't being unfairly taxed just for helping their fellow Michiganders during this pandemic.

Agriculture is a critical part of Michigan’s economy. I am pushing for the Coronavirus legislation we’re working on in the Senate to ensure Michigan’s farmers are included and to allow farmers to contribute to our federal food assistance programs. https://t.co/3otbar4Z44

Michigan is the Arsenal of Democracy and we have the best engineers and manufacturers in the world. Good news that @Ford, with the help of @UAW, will make medical equipment including ventilators to help confront Coronavirus.
 
https://t.co/TLNLgnzBhU

The Trump Administration should re-open health care enrollment to allow Americans & Michiganders without coverage or who have short-term plans to purchase insurance. This a commonsense step that could be taken right now as we confront Coronavirus. #ACA10

On the 10th Anniv of the #AffordableCareAct & as we face this public health crisis, the need to ensure Michiganders access affordable care is more important than ever.

As Michiganders & Americans continue to grapple with the spread of Coronavirus, it’s crystal clear we must ensure access to quality, affordable health care.
